meanings.definition: To turn up soil with a plough.
meanings.sent1: The farmer ploughed the field to prepare it for planting.
meanings.sent2: She ploughed through the garden, digging up the earth with the plough.
meanings.sent3: The plough ploughed the soil so vigorously, it seemed to dance.
meanings.sent4: His determination ploughed through the obstacles like a powerful machine.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the plough ploughing the field echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The ship ploughed through the rough waves of the stormy sea.
meanings.sent2: The bulldozer ploughed through the thick wall effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The determined athlete ploughed through the race, leaving others behind.
meanings.sent4: Her words ploughed through his defenses, leaving him vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The car ploughed through the snow, leaving a clear path behind.

meanings.definition: To invest money in a business venture.
meanings.sent1: He ploughed his savings into the new startup company.
meanings.sent2: They ploughed their funds into the promising business opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The investor ploughed through various options before deciding on the right venture.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to plough money into the project paid off handsomely.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur ploughed his resources into the innovative idea, hoping for success.
